moves.1... e5: i have to force me to do this.
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6: the only one i know best
moves.3... Nc6: for once i decided to play the four knights.
moves.4. Bc4 Bb4 5. Ng5: well this is a very old trap...
moves.5... O-O 6. d3 h6 7. Nf3: and back... you lost a move
moves.8. exd5 Nxd5 9. Bxd5 Qxd5 10. O-O Bxc3 1: for now, i have a better pawn structure... that is all... maybe i should reconsider 4-knights for later games... :-) (just kidding, i know he made mistakes)
moves.11... Bg4: i hoped to double another pawn
moves.12. c4 Qe6: i have hesitated with Bxf3, but i finally lose...
moves.13. h3 Bh5 14. g4: another hesitation... but nothing good against an opponent that can study the game
moves.16. Nh2 fxg4 17. hxg4: the best move, i think All the others were a catastrophy
moves.21. fxg4 Qd6 22. Rxf7 Bxf7 23. Re1 Re8 2: i counted that my bishop was better than his knight: i can force him to stay by his c2 and a2 pawns and go to explore by myself... On the other side, he will try to force my king to stay on my side... And by succeeding this, it is a draw.
moves.30. Kf4 Ke7 31. Nd2: intending to play Nb2 in case i attack on a4, which was my goal in case his horse went to close to my king
moves.31... Bc6 32. Nb3 b6: i don't want his horse on this side of the board
moves.36. Nb1 b5 37. cxb5 axb5: have to be very careful to avoid the draw or the free a-pawn
moves.40. a3 Ke5: but first I approach to protect d4... And here, in case of Nf3, i planned to take the horse, install the king on d5 and go on with c5. Unstoppable.
moves.41. Nb1 c4 42. Nd2: this is the defense i did not expect, but it didn't change my plan.
moves.42... c3: Yes! i guess he did not expect this one!
moves.43. Nf3+ Bxf3 44. Kxf3 Kd5 45. Ke2 Kc5:
i expected the meeting on a3 by 
46 Kd1 Kb6 (not b4 that leads to a draw) 47. Kc1 Ka5 48. Kb1 Ka4 and force him to zugzwang after 49 Ka2 b4 50. axb Kxb4 and I go back to his g-pawn...
moves.50. Ke5 Kxc2 51. Kf5 Kxd3 52. Kxg5 c2 53: next is my Q on 7th line... it is over...
